definition: to accumulate/to gather/to amass wealth by heavy taxation or other unscrupulous means/(science) convergent
to congregate/to assemble/to mass/to gather together/to amass/to polymerize
to hold back/to restrain/to control (oneself)/to collect/Taiwan pr. [lian4]

sentences.english: After amassing fortunes, early employees start walking out the door.
sentences.chinese: 在聚斂了巨大的財富後，早期員工開始紛紛離去。

sentences.english: Provideth her meat in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.
sentences.chinese: 尚且在夏天豫備食物，在收割時聚斂糧食。

sentences.english: And I amassed in my own treasure-hose the money due to my king.
sentences.chinese: 我把我的國王的錢財聚斂在自己的寶庫裏。

sentences.english: he spent most of his life gathering money.
sentences.chinese: 他一生大部分的時間都用來聚斂錢財。

sentences.english: Forty years now they collected the money.
sentences.chinese: 他們聚斂錢財已經有40年了。

sentences.english: You have amassed wealth, but all of it is at risk.
sentences.chinese: 你有聚斂錢財，但它們全都是處於危險之中。

sentences.english: He amassed a fortune by speculating on the stock exchange.
sentences.chinese: 他靠證券交易投機聚斂了一大筆錢財。

sentences.english: He spent most of his life to gathering money.
sentences.chinese: 他一生大部分的時間都用來聚斂錢財。
